DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of systematic investigation using controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.:The use of controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

Concepts.definition: Systematic investigation into a subject in order to discover facts, establish or revise a theory, or develop a plan of action based on the facts discovered.

Property.preferredDefinition: The use of controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses.

Concepts.definition: The use of controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The use of controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an amplified nucleotide sample that was derived from a single cell.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an amplified nucleotide sample that was derived from a single cell.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that can determine the nucleotide sequence for all of the RNA transcripts in an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual.

Concepts.definition: A procedure that can determine the DNA sequence for all of the exons in an individual.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An assessment of disease process to include cause, development, and/or structural and functional changes associated with the disease.

Concepts.definition: An assessment of disease process to include cause, development, and/or structural and functional changes associated with the disease.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Any technique designed to amplify a limited genomic DNA sample so as to generate a new sample that is indistinguishable from the original but with a higher DNA concentration.

Concepts.definition: Any technique designed to amplify a limited genomic DNA sample so as to generate a new sample that is indistinguishable from the original but with a higher DNA concentration.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A DNA sequencing technique that can differentiate cytosine from 5-methylcytosine in a DNA sample. First, a denatured DNA sample is treated with bisulfite which converts non-methylated cytosine to uracil. Next, the sample is amplified using a PCR method that does not discriminate between non-methylated and methylated sequences. The amplified DNA is subjected to nucleotide sequencing. The resulting sequence is compared to an identical control sample of DNA that was not treated with bisulfite. Unmethylated cytosines will be displayed as cytosines in the control sample and as thymines in the bisulfite-treated sample.

Concepts.definition: A DNA sequencing technique that can differentiate cytosine from 5-methylcytosine in a DNA sample. First, a denatured DNA sample is treated with bisulfite which converts non-methylated cytosine to uracil. Next, the sample is amplified using a PCR method that does not discriminate between non-methylated and methylated sequences. The amplified DNA is subjected to nucleotide sequencing. The resulting sequence is compared to an identical control sample of DNA that was not treated with bisulfite. Unmethylated cytosines will be displayed as cytosines in the control sample and as thymines in the bisulfite-treated sample.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

Concepts.definition: The branch of medical science dealing with the medical use of X-rays or other penetrating radiation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The use of a high-throughput microarray where all of the known CpG islands either in a single specimen or all of the known promoter sequences of a specimen or a population group are coupled to beads or microwells to determine which are methylated.

Concepts.definition: The use of a high-throughput microarray where all of the known CpG islands either in a single specimen or all of the known promoter sequences of a specimen or a population group are coupled to beads or microwells to determine which are methylated.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A set of proprietary assays designed to detect and identify gene fusions, other genetic mutations and changes in gene expression levels that are clinical markers for various cancers. The assay leverages anchored multiplex PCR (AMP) to amplify disease-specific sequences at sufficient levels for targeted next generation sequencing.

Concepts.definition: A set of proprietary assays designed to detect and identify gene fusions, other genetic mutations and changes in gene expression levels that are clinical markers for various cancers. The assay leverages anchored multiplex PCR (AMP) to amplify disease-specific sequences at sufficient levels for targeted next generation sequencing.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Any specific activity undertaken during the course of a clinical study or research protocol.

Concepts.definition: The use of controlled observations and measurements to test hypotheses.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
